goals.title: Goal 1
goals.explanation: These labs are indicated for initial evaluation of suspected fluid overload and metabolic imbalance.

source.content: According to Smithfield et al. (2024), clinical evaluation of fluid status should include a comprehensive metabolic panel to assess electrolyte imbalances which may contribute to or result from fluid retention.
source.citation: Smithfield, J., Johnson, K., & Lee, M. (2024). Modern approaches to fluid management in acute care settings. Journal of Emergency Medicine, 48(3), 326-342.

goals.title: Fluids
goals.author: Shreya
goals.explanation: Isotonic fluid replacement helps restore intravascular volume without causing significant shifts in electrolyte concentrations.

source.content: Current guidelines from the International Fluid Management Society recommend careful titration of isotonic crystalloids in patients with heart failure, with a preference for balanced solutions when possible.
source.citation: Rodriguez, A., et al. (2025). Fluid management strategies in acute decompensated heart failure. Heart Failure Reviews, 30(1), 42-53.

goals.title: Goal 2
list: Consider CPAP if respiratory distress persists
Monitor for signs of respiratory fatigue
goals.explanation: Optimization of oxygenation is critical in acute heart failure to reduce work of breathing and improve tissue perfusion.

source.content: A randomized controlled trial by Chen et al. demonstrated that early optimization of oxygenation in acute heart failure reduced intubation rates by 28% compared to standard care protocols.
source.citation: Chen, L., et al. (2023). Early respiratory optimization strategies in acute heart failure: a multicenter randomized controlled trial. JAMA Cardiology, 8(4), 312-320.
